title: What skills did you learn in kindergarten that made you a better person today? - Quora

response.answer_text: I never went to kindergarten. It was war time. My mum and I moved to near where dad was stationed in the Royal Air Force. We lived in bed sitting room. We spent a lot of time exploring and picking flowers. She read a lot to me and I learned to read before I was five. I also knew my multiplication tables which made a big difference when I went to school at five, to a one teacher school where I taught contemporaries to read. So it gave me an excellent start in school life.

It’s difficult to attribute a specific skill to that time, but if I had to guess, I would have to say playing well with others would be at the top of the list. Also, a realization that I was not the only person my age in the world and an appreciation for the creative arts such as painting.
